history.content:
In my opinion, CS61C and CS170 are pretty heavy workloads...taking 4 technicals in itself will be a large workload. I would choose to take Physics 7B instead of CS170 if you wanted a easier workload though.

------------------------------------------------

7B does not have too much overlap with 7A, since it covers electricity and magnetism. You might need to know some kinematics, and you should be familiar with some stuff like newtons laws, springs, angular momentum, etc, but these will mainly show up somewhat sparingly on the homework. The exams usually do not have parts that heavily rely on 7A material, although I cannot guarantee that because I'm speaking solely from experience.

In my opinion, CS61C and CS170 are pretty heavy workloads...taking 4 technicals in itself will be a large workload. I would choose to take Physics 7B instead of CS170 if you wanted a easier workload though.

Hi everyone!

I am looking to take either CS170 or Physics 7B next semester alongside CS61C, Data 8, Stat 88, and an R5B. I will be taking CS70 and Physics 7A over the summer, so I am wondering which class would carry over more to its counterpart or would just complement my schedule better in terms of workload or any other factor. For context I have taken CS61A/B, EE16A/B, Math 53/54.

Please respond with any advice!
history.subject: CS170 vs Physics 7B for Fall Semester
